title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0016

segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name's Erica, and I'm here with... Marco!
Hurry up, Marco, we've got a lesson!
We have a great lesson for you today.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节很棒的课。

segments.en: That's right, an elementary lesson about being in a rush, and about giving directions when you're in a car.
segments.cn: 没错，是关于匆忙和在车里给方向的初级课。

segments.en: We're going to listen to two friends who are getting in a car, and they're getting ready to go somewhere, and they're in a big hurry.
segments.cn: 我们将听两个朋友，他们正在上车，准备去某个地方，而且非常着急。

segments.en: So let's hurry up and listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以让我们快点听对话。

segments.en: No wait, I meant make a right!
Don't worry about it, just drive.
Oh no, the light is about to change, step on it!
segments.cn: 哦不，红灯要变了，快踩油门！

segments.en: I'm not going to run a red light!
The freeway will be packed at this hour.
segments.cn: 这个时间高速公路会很拥挤。

segments.en: Go on, get out of our way!
Jeez, having a fit is not going to help.
Just go down here, and we'll cut through Ashburn Heights.
segments.cn: 就沿着这条路走，我们可以穿过Ashburn Heights。

segments.en: I'm going as fast as I can.
So, they were in a hurry, and it was all just to get to the library.
segments.cn: 所以，他们很着急，都是为了去图书馆。

segments.en: Well, maybe he was late returning a book or something.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许他是因为还书迟到了。

segments.en: That's a bit dramatic, just for returning a book.
segments.cn: 这有点戏剧化，仅仅是还书。

segments.en: Alright, why don't we look at our language takeaway for today.
segments.cn: 好吧，为什么我们不看看今天的语言要点呢。

segments.en: Ok, on today's language takeaway, we have five words for you today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言要点，我们有五个单词。

segments.en: Five really important and useful words that we found in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 五个在对话中非常重要和有用的单词。

segments.en: So, let's take a look at the first one.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们看看第一个。

segments.en: So, what does it mean when I tell you to step on it?
segments.cn: 那么，当我告诉你“踩油门”是什么意思？

segments.en: You might also say, speed up.

segments.cn: 我们的第二个单词，加速。

segments.en: Ok, so speed up and slow down.
So, our third word for today is, having a fit.
segments.cn: 我们今天的第三个单词是，发脾气。

segments.en: Well, this is a funny phrase, and I think listening to a few examples of this phrase might help us understand its meaning a little bit better.
segments.cn: 这是个有趣的短语，我认为听几个例子会帮助我们更好地理解它的意思。

segments.en: Geez, you don't need to have a fit.
Nothing is going to happen if we're five minutes late.
segments.cn: 如果我们晚五分钟也没关系。

segments.en: My boss is going to have a fit if I don't finish this on time.
segments.cn: 如果我不按时完成，我的老板会发脾气。

segments.en: I almost had a fit when my boss told me I had to work this weekend.
segments.cn: 当我的老板告诉我这个周末要工作时，我差点发脾气。

segments.en: So, Erica, why don't you tell me, what does it mean when you have a fit?
segments.cn: 所以，Erica，告诉我，当你发脾气时是什么意思？

segments.en: It means you get really angry and you can't control your emotions.
segments.cn: 这意味着你非常生气，无法控制自己的情绪。

segments.en: So maybe you start screaming and maybe some steam comes out of your ears.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会开始尖叫，可能耳朵里会冒出蒸汽。

segments.en: Ok, let's take a look at our next word now.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: When you cut through something, it means you just... Go through.
segments.cn: 当你穿过某物时，意味着你只是... 通过。

segments.en: It gives you the idea that you go through something quickly.
segments.cn: 这给你一种快速通过某物的感觉。

segments.en: Quickly, so I can say, let's cut through the park.
segments.cn: 快速，所以我可以说，让我们穿过公园。

segments.en: Yep, or let's cut through the backyard.
segments.cn: 是的，或者让我们穿过后院。

segments.en: And this takes us to our last word for today.
segments.cn: 这带我们到今天的最后一个单词。

segments.en: This is a really common word and not many people know about it.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的词，但很多人不知道。

segments.en: It's two simple words that when you fit them together, the meaning changes.
segments.cn: 这是两个简单的词，组合在一起时，意思就变了。

segments.en: It's a great example of this real English we talk about.
segments.cn: 这是我们所说的真实英语的一个很好的例子。

segments.en: And it means to take a shorter way somewhere.
segments.cn: 它的意思是走一条更短的路。

segments.en: So if I take a shortcut, I go the short way.
segments.cn: 所以如果我走捷径，我就走了短路。

segments.en: Ok, so going back just a little bit to cut through.
segments.cn: 好的，稍微回到“切”的部分。

segments.en: If I cut through the park, that's basically a shortcut.
segments.cn: 如果我穿过公园，那基本上就是捷径。

segments.en: Now it's time to listen to our dialogue again, but this time it's going to be slower so then we can understand all these words that we just talked about.
segments.cn: 现在是时候再听一遍我们的对话了，但这次会慢一点，这样我们可以理解刚才讨论的所有词。

segments.en: Oh no, the light is about to change.
I'm not going to run a red light.
The freeway will be packed at this hour.
segments.cn: 这个时间高速公路会很拥挤。

segments.en: Geez, having a fit is not going to help.
Just go down here and we'll cut through Ashburn Heights.
segments.cn: 就在这里走，我们会穿过阿什本高地。

segments.en: I'm going as fast as I can.
Ok, well I think that was a lot more clear this time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得这次更清楚了。

segments.en: You know there was some great language in that dialogue and I would like to look at how we can put it together.
segments.cn: 你知道对话中有一些很好的语言，我想看看我们如何将其结合起来。

segments.en: Ok, so today on putting it together we have three phrases for you.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在结合起来的部分我们有三个短语给你。

segments.en: And we're going to show you how you can use these phrases like a native speaker.
segments.cn: 我们将向你展示如何像母语者一样使用这些短语。

segments.en: Ok, so all of these phrases we heard in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，这些短语都是我们在对话中听到的。

segments.en: Why don't we start with the first one.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不从第一个开始。

segments.en: So in the dialogue they say make a left here.
segments.cn: 在对话中他们说在这里左转。

segments.en: Yeah, and we can extend this phrase to say make a right.
segments.cn: 是的，我们可以扩展这个短语说右转。

segments.en: That would be the equivalent of saying turn left.
Exactly, that means turn the car 180 degrees all the way around.
segments.cn: 正是，这意味着把车转180度。

segments.en: So make a left, make a right, make a U-turn.
If you're ever in a taxi and you're telling the taxi driver where to go, this is the perfect way.
segments.cn: 如果你在出租车里告诉司机该怎么走，这就是完美的方式。

segments.en: Make a left here, make a right there.
Ok, so let's move to our second phrase and it is...
segments.cn: 好的，我们来看看第二个短语，它是...

segments.en: So this is a great way of saying... Are you crazy?
So when would we use a phrase like this?
segments.cn: 我们什么时候会用到这样的短语？

segments.en: If somebody has a bad idea that you don't agree with, you would say are you crazy or are you nuts?
segments.cn: 如果有人有一个你不同意的坏主意，你会说你疯了吗？

segments.en: So Marco, let's stop this podcast right now.
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，我们现在就停止这个播客。

segments.en: Ok, I think that's a good example of how we can use this phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得这是一个很好的例子，说明我们如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: So let's listen to some examples of are you nuts?
segments.cn: 所以我们来听一些“你疯了吗？”的例子。

segments.en: You want to get married now?
You only met her three weeks ago.
I'm not going to cheat on the exam.
And now we can move to our third phrase, which is...
segments.cn: 现在我们可以进入第三个短语，那个是...

segments.en: Again, so if you're in a taxi, this is a great way to suggest a route.
segments.cn: 再次，如果你在出租车里，这是建议路线的好方法。

segments.en: So we can take this phrase and extend it out with a few more words.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以把这个短语扩展几句话。

segments.en: So let's take a side street.
Ok, so now let's take a listen to this dialogue a third time at its normal speed.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们再听一遍这个对话，正常速度。

segments.en: And now you can understand everything that's in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在你可以理解这个对话中的一切。

segments.en: No wait, I meant make a right.
Don't worry about it, just drive.
Oh no, the light is about to change.
I'm not going to run a red light.
The freeway will be packed at this hour.
segments.cn: 这个时候高速公路会很拥挤。

segments.en: Go on, get out of our way.
Geez, having a fit is not going to help.
Just go down here and we'll cut through Ashburn Heights.
segments.cn: 就沿着这条路，我们会穿过阿什本高地。

segments.en: I'm going as fast as I can.
Well this dialogue is all about driving, right?
segments.cn: 这个对话全是关于开车的，对吧？

segments.en: And in North America, where both of us are from, driving is everything.
segments.cn: 在我们来自的北美，开车是最重要的。

segments.en: When did you get a car?
Well, my car I got when I was like maybe 19.
But I learned how to drive and I was driving already by the age of 16.
segments.cn: 但我16岁时就学会开车了。

segments.en: In many countries, you have to wait until I think you're 18 to drive.
segments.cn: 在许多国家，你必须等到18岁才能开车。

segments.en: But in North America, everyone has a driver's license by the time they're 16 years old.
segments.cn: 但在北美，16岁时每个人都有驾照。

segments.en: I guess everything is so far away that you need a car.
segments.cn: 我想一切都太远了，所以你需要一辆车。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a lot less likely to have subways or trains to travel by in North America.
segments.cn: 是的，在北美，乘坐地铁或火车的可能性小得多。

segments.en: Alright, so now you have all the tools necessary to give directions the next time you're in a car or in a taxi.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你有了所有必要的工具，下次在车里或出租车里时可以给出方向。

segments.en: Well everyone, I really hope you enjoyed this lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我真的希望你们喜欢这节课。

segments.en: Now I want to remind you all to come to our EnglishPod website at EnglishPod.com and here you'll find a lot of tools to help you understand our podcasts better.
segments.cn: 现在我想提醒大家访问我们的EnglishPod网站，EnglishPod.com，在这里你会找到很多工具，帮助你更好地理解我们的播客。

segments.en: So with that, until next time, this is goodbye.
segments.cn: 所以就这样，下次见，再见。
